editorialSummary.text: Compact rooms in a colorful modern property offering a hip rooftop bar & a 20th-floor gym.

originalText.text:
citizenM is always a great experience, and I will recommend it to anyone. But the Times Square location provided a few challenges once we got to our room. There was a button missing on one of the control panels (and the lettering was fading from most of the other buttons, so it was hard to render what they controlled). Neither the window blind nor the curtain functioned properly. The television had intermittent picture & sound issues. And, we had two hotel-supplied hair dryers fail on us, with slow service from the staff when we requested replacements. Also, it was very cold in NYC this weekend (below-freezing), and with the bed right next to the window, I could feel the draft of cold air as I slept, and standing moisture had gathered on the windowsill by morning.

However, none of this sullied my opinion of citizenM. I will always stay with them when I'm in a city where one exists. It's a really unique, great experience, and an incredible value when compared to its peers. I do love the 21st-century functionality of the room and the efficiencies of space. The confines are small, but cozy. Not uncomfortable at all. The bed is amazing. The staff is very friendly and helpful, even if the hair dryer replacement took a while.

But there were some things about this particular room that could have been improved to make this experience even better.

originalText.text: I loved the interaction during initial arrival. My best friend and I arrived over a few hours before check in-time. Even though the hotel was full so no room for early check in, we were met with front desk host who was very friendly and accommodating. It was such a relief to know they could store our bags so we didn’t have to lug around the city with our things. They even went out of their way to provide a few recommendations. To be frank this is what turned a 1 star review into 3 stars. With out this interaction I would’ve been left with the frustrations of the room condition when we finally checked in.. Some of the light switches didn’t work, the blinds wouldn’t come down, the apple play didn’t work well, and the shower door didn’t shut. I expected the room to be pretty tight for 2 as I’ve had the pleasure of visiting a location in Seattle (newer property). It just seemed much tighter. The maintenance guy was able to come in & get the blinds unstuck but had to step on our BED in order to do so. At least they got a sheet I suppose. I understand with it being the new year, allot of places are booked but we were pretty disappointed in them not being able to accommodate us with a different room after notifying them of the first 15 minutes of being there of the room’s condition. Anyway, to end this review on a positive note, the location is great if your aim is to be in time square. Pretty walkable to great eats and entertainment. Be sure to bring your good walking shoes and be weary of the New Year’s eve chaos.

Be sure to bring your good walking shoes and be weary of the New Year’s eve chaos.

originalText.text:
All around nice hotel. Location is right near times square (good or bad depending on how you see it) and really close to several subway stations.

Rooms are small but cozy. The app to control the room's lights, ventilation, etc is great and works really good.
Bed is huge considering the room's size and comfortable as well.

Checkin and checkout was really smooth and they even had our rooms ready prior to the check in time which was a nice addition.

Staff is super friendly. They happily stored some food on the fridge/freezer for us and took our requests no problem.
I did however order some stuff online (after letting them know) and for some reason the package was refused which made me have to refund the order, but other than that everything was great.

Didn't try the breakfast here but we did order some food and its was quite good, though they did take some time to prep it.

Price was pretty much the same as all other hotels in the area and of this calibre, though I'd say probably a bit cheaper than other 4 star hotels.

Probably not staying near times square again (too much chaos) if returning but would definitely check out other citizenM locations.

originalText.text: Staff were very welcoming and friendly for the entire stay. Service is above and beyond, special mention to Roy, Ben and Rovne. Room is small and comfortable. Hotel is quirky and atmospheric. Location is perfect, so central. Recommend staying on a high floor for a great view.

text.text: Staff were very welcoming and friendly for the entire stay. Service is above and beyond, special mention to Roy, Ben and Rovne. Room is small and comfortable. Hotel is quirky and atmospheric. Location is perfect, so central. Recommend staying on a high floor for a great view.

originalText.text:
Honestly, we had a good stay at this hotel and I would have recommended it, however an experience with their customer service afterwards completely soured the experience.

We left something important in our room (my wedding ring). Totally my fault, not the hotel's. However, you cannot call the hotel directly. You can only call their international call center. I waited on hold for 90 minutes to finally be transferred to the front desk of the actual hotel. They said they would check on my lost item, and then hung up on me. I'm willing to give them the benefit of the doubt that this was an accident, but still, I was left with no remedy but to call back and wait another 90 minutes? This time I decided to try the chat and waited 40 minutes to speak to a real person, who basically told me I could try calling the central number again, because "there is no direct number". After pushing for a more reasonable solution, they said they would have the front desk call me back. They did eventually call me back 8 hours later to let me know they did not find the ring.

Next time I will book at a hotel that wants to assist their patrons in solving basic problems. You should not have sit on hold for hours to ask a simple question.
